\Aura\CliVt100

Text formatting for VT100 terminals.

Properties

$format

$format : array

Array of format conversions for use on a variety of pre-set console style combinations.

Based on ANSI VT100 Color/Style Codes according to the VT100 User Guide and the ANSI/VT100 Terminal Control reference. Inspired by PEAR Console_Color.

Type

array

Tags

None found

$posix

$posix : bool

The POSIX terminal flag.

Type

bool

See also

$php_os

$php_os : string

The PHP_OS value. Provided so we can fake the OS as needed.

Type

string

Tags

None found

Methods

setPosix()

setPosix(bool $flag) : void

Forces output to format for POSIX terminals, or to strip for non-POSIX terminals; when null, will auto-determine if the terminal is POSIX.

Parameters

bool $flag

True to force formatting, false to force stripping, or null to auto-determine.

Tags

None found

getPosix()

getPosix() : bool

Gets the value of the POSIX terminal flag.

Returns

bool

Tags

format()

format(string $text) : string

Converts VT100 %-markup in text to control codes.

Parameters

string $text

The text to format.

Returns

string —

The formatted text.

Tags

None found

strip()

strip(string $text) : string

Strips VT100 %-markup from text.

Parameters

string $text

The text to strip %-markup from.

Returns

string —

The plain text.

Tags

None found

write()

write(\Aura\Cli\StdioResource $resource, string $text) : void

Writes text to a file handle, converting to control codes if the handle is a posix TTY, or to plain text if not.

Parameters

\Aura\Cli\StdioResource $resource

The file handle.
string $text

The text to write to the file handle, converting %-markup if the handle is a posix TTY, or stripping markup if not.

See also

Tags

None found

writeln()

writeln(\Aura\Cli\StdioResource $resource, string $text) : void

Writes text to a file handle, converting to control codes if the handle is a posix TTY, or to plain text if not, and then appends a newline.

Parameters

\Aura\Cli\StdioResource $resource

The file handle.
string $text

The text to write to the file handle, converting %-markup if the handle is a posix TTY, or stripping markup if not.

See also

Tags

None found

isPosix()

isPosix(\Aura\Cli\StdioResource $resource) : bool

Determines if a stream handle should be treated as a POSIX terminal.

Parameters

\Aura\Cli\StdioResource $resource

The stream handle.

Returns

bool
